quotes.quote: Simplicity is a delicate imposition.
A delicate thought is a flower of the mind.
Meditation is the delicate art of doing nothing.
Delicate humor is the crowning virtue of the saints.
Mind is a most delicate evidence. Not a soul has seen it yet.
The delicate balance between modesty and conceit is popularity.
Fine and delicate taste is the fruit of education and experience.
Many things are too delicate to be thought; many more, to be spoken.
The imagination is of so delicate a texture that even words wound it.
Pride is seldom delicate: it will please itself with very mean advantages.
To dispense with ceremony is the most delicate mode of conferring a compliment.
The point of life is to find the delicate equilibrium between dream and reality.
Food's delicate. You have to handle it with finesse. You can't just be a big ogre.
When you see how fragile and delicate life can be, all else fades into the background.
A beginning is the time for taking the most delicate care that the balances are correct.
Writing is the delicate, difficult, and dangerous means of succeeding in avowing the unavowable.
Even dreams, the most delicate and intangible of things, can prove remarkable difficult to kill.
The more delicate and ambitious the soul, the further do dreams estrange it from possible things.
I'll have you know that the most delicate flowers often produce the strongest scent when crushed.
There is always a very delicate interplay between individual actions and institutional conditions.
You have to be delicate with how you can portray characters other people are having a worship over.
Success is the result of a delicate balance between making things happen and letting things happen.
Our taste is too delicate and particular. It says nay to the poet's work, but never yea to his hope.
The most delicate, the most sensible of all pleasures, consists in promoting the pleasure of others.
It is a very delicate job to forgive a man, without lowering him in his own estimation, and yours too.
The reactions of the human heart are not mechanical and predictable but infinitely subtle and delicate.
Since love is the most delicate and total act of a soul, it will reflect the state and nature of the soul.
Some delicate matters must be treated like pins, because if they are not seized by the right end, we get pricked.
The delicate and infirm go for sympathy, not to the well and buoyant, but to those who have suffered like themselves.
We have learned to express the more delicate nuances of feeling by penetrating more deeply into the mysteries of harmony.
Nothing is so delicate as the reputation of a woman; it is at once the most beautiful and most brittle of all human things.
Friends should be very delicate and careful in administering pity as medicine, when enemies use the same article as poison.
Women are delicate creatures. Fragile. Gentle. Made by God to be sheltered from the harshness of this world. *- Morgan MacDonnell
The voice of conscience is so delicate that it is easy to stifle it; but it is also so clear that it is impossible to mistake it.
The delicate balance of mentoring someone is not creating them in your own image, but giving them the opportunity to create themselves.
The human heart is so delicate and sensitive that it always needs some tangible encouragement to prevent it from faltering in its labour.
A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
Be as delicate as possible. If communication accomplishes something on the gross but damages something on the level of feeling then it is a spiritual loss! The feeling is more important for life.
